page.title: 02POPULATION TRENDS GLENFIELD
page.content: In{1086, there were 12 families}living in Glenfield. All would have been born here, except the priest. By the{1851 census,after the railway had been here 19 years,there were{544 people,}1 in 8 were born outside Leicestershire. 70 years ago, people in Glenfield rarely visited Leicester,4 miles away. A 1985 school survey shows that, of 266 parents, 2 in 5 were born outside the county. People come to Glenfield because it is a pleasant place to live conveniently near to the countryside & the City of Leicester which provides employment,shopping and other services and enjoys good communications.Instead of being a self-contained community,as it was within the lifetime of the elderly villagers, mobility has made Glenfield almost a suburb of Leicester with{an estimated population of 8855. This growth is still going on.
